dataset.description: The City of Melbourne has automated pedestrian counting sensors located across the city. These sensors provide pedestrian counts for the previous hour at the given location. Counts are currently uploaded on a monthly basis.
dataset.title: Pedestrian Counts

dataset.description: The Rooftop Project dataset shows where there may be opportunities to retrofit existing building rooftops for green roofs (intensive and extensive), cool roofs and solar panel installations in Melbourne. PLEASE NOTE: This File is in a geoTiff format, if you would like access to the Esri Geodatabase file, this is available for download from the attachments section below.
dataset.title: The Rooftop Project  (please see the full description for instructions)

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne owns and maintains various objects and pieces of equipment installed on streets and roads for various purposes. This dataset includes Barbeques, Bicycle Rails, Bin Corrals, Bollards, Drinking Fountains, Floral Crate/Planter Boxs, Hoops, Horse Troughs, Information Pillars, Litter Bins, Picnic Setting, Seats.
dataset.title: Outdoor Furniture

dataset.description:
The number of patents issued to resident persons or corporations of a city is an indicator of innovation, which is a result of the production and use of knowledge.
 
The patents counted in this indicator were 'standard' and 'innovation patents. Standard patents are granted only for inventions - in other words an invention that is not an obvious thing to do for someone with knowledge and experience in the technological field of the invention. The innovation patent is granted for an incremental advance on existing technology or knowledge that makes a substantial contribution to the working of the invention.
dataset.title: Standard And Innovation Patents by Postcode In Melbourne Municipality 2010-14

dataset.description:
The number of patents issued to resident persons or corporations of a city is an indicator of innovation, which is a result of the production and use of knowledge.
 
 
 
 The patents counted in this indicator were 'standard' and 'innovation patents. Standard patents are granted only for inventions - in other words an invention that is not an obvious thing to do for someone with knowledge and experience in the technological field of the invention. The innovation patent is granted for an incremental advance on existing technology or knowledge that makes a substantial contribution to the working of the invention.
 
 
 
 To derive the figure for per 100,000 residents, the total number of patents granted annually to individuals and entities living or working in the municipality is divided by the municipality's population divided by 100,000. The result is a figures expressed as the number of new patents granted per 100,000 population.
dataset.title: Innovation - New Patents Granted

dataset.description: Mapping of greening potential in lanes. 'Greening' refers to four types of possible greening responses: forest lanes, farm lanes, park lanes and vertical gardens. Higher gridcodes indicate lower potential for adaptation - i.e. a gridcode of 1 is optimal.
dataset.title: Greening Laneways

dataset.description:
In 2014 City of Melbourne reported, to the World Council on City Data (WCCD), 76 indicators of quality of life and city performance for the municipality. The dataset demonstrates Melbourne's Liveability using objective data. It is also available in summarised form on the WCCD's open data portal.

Indicators include: Fire and emergency response; Governance; Health; Recreation; Safety; Shelter; Solid Waste; Telecommunications and Innovation; Transportation; Urban Planning; Wastewater; Water and Sanitation; Economy; Education; Energy; Environment; and Finance.

This data can best be used to benchmark Melbourne's liveability compared to other cities around the world. Governments can use the data to promote the advantages of Melbourne globally (such as ‘liveability’ or economic/investment potential); inform and engage ‘communities of interest’ in decision making; inform decisions through data analysis; input to discussions of targets through benchmarking; evaluate impacts of government interventions and infrastructure projects on the performance of the city; and establish a basis for information sharing about what works between Melbourne and other cities.

In 2015 City of Melbourne is again reporting, to WCCD, indicators for Melbourne Local Government Area. In addition, statistics for Greater Melbourne will be reported and both data sets will be published on the open data portal.

All indicators in this table conform with the new international standard (ISO) for city indicators - ISO37120 which is managed by WCCD. The standard is attached below. Web link to comparative data on the WCCD open data portal is below.
dataset.title: Indicators of Quality of Life and City Services

dataset.description: Polygon data of Garbage Collection Zones for the City of Melbourne. Includes waste and recycling, with date, repeat and interval in ISO8601. Data was created following the Open Council Data Standards. Data field metadata can be found here: http://opencouncildata.org/#open-council-data-garbage-collection-zones-22. Although all due care has been taken to ensure that these data are correct, no warranty is expressed or implied by the City of Melbourne in their use.
dataset.title: Melbourne Garbage Collection Zones

dataset.description: Our Community Food Guide is a resource for community agencies or anyone in the community who needs information about how to access affordable fresh and healthy food, including where to get food parcels or free and affordable meals for those in need.
dataset.title: Community Food

dataset.description: This dataset powers the Events page.
dataset.title: Events

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne maintains more than 70,000 trees. This dataset details the location, species and lifespan of Melbourne's urban forest by precinct. To explore Melbourne's tree data and learn more about the life expectancy and diversity of trees in your city, check out our interactive tree map http://melbourneurbanforestvisual.com.au/, You can download the City of Melbourne's Urban forest Strategy and the summary of your  precinct's consultation from the attachments section by selecting the 'About' button
dataset.title: Melbourne's Urban Forest Tree data

dataset.description: May 2015 edition of City of Melbourne's Development Activity Monitor. The project monitors major new commercial and residential property development in the City of Melbourne municipality. The outputs can inform short to medium-term supply forecasts in the commercial and residential markets. This data provides our current understanding of major development sites that are recently completed, under construction, planned or mooted in all of 13 small areas of the city.
dataset.title: Development Activity Monitor

dataset.description: This data set shows the locations of the signs that the city of Melbourne classifies as Wayfinding. These could include traditional tourism related maps, Street signs with directional numbers
dataset.title: Wayfinding

dataset.description: This data set shows the locations of the bus stops within the city of Melbourne, As the city of Melbourne do not run the bus services, this is simply to show the locations of the stops, this data does not include the services that run from each of the stops.
dataset.title: Bus stop Locations

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne has designated outdoor no smoking areas which are above and beyond those areas designated in the tobacco act. This dataset displays the outdoor areas which the City of Melbourne has the authority to designate as no smoking areas
dataset.title: Outdoor No Smoking Areas

dataset.description: This dataset outline the Lux levels emitted from the City of Melbourne owned street lights. The Lux level is stored in the label field and the higher the Lux level the brighter the point of measurement will be.
dataset.title: Lux Level

dataset.description: This map shows the locations and outlines of all footpaths located within the city of Melbourne
dataset.title: Footpaths

dataset.description: This dataset shows the location and names of all of the bookable event spaces available to the general public (applications apply) this dataset also shows which events are suitable, whether dogs are allowed and whether they are smoke free or not.
dataset.title: Bookable Event Venues

dataset.description: This dataset is a shapefile that contains all of the tram tracks within the city of Melbourne, this data set is generally used for City of Melbourne related queries, therefor we do not hold the entire tram network
dataset.title: Tram track locations

dataset.description: This data set is a map displaying the locations of all public lights / street lights located within the City of Melbourne. this dataset includes lights that are owned by the city of Melbourne and those that are owned by third parties
dataset.title: Public Lighting

dataset.description: This data set displays the primary CBD emergency evacuation centres within the city of Melbourne and referenced in our emergency management plans.
dataset.title: Evacuation Centres

dataset.description: Co-ordinates of the City of Melbourne's pedestrian sensors. Please refer to the Pedestrian Counts dataset for more information on the counts each sensor reports.
dataset.title: Pedestrian Sensor Locations

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne conducted community engagement about the draft Bicycle Plan 2016-2020. We had an unprecedented number of comments from the public with; 1000 individual spots, 1350 comments, 4500 supports. The City of Melbourne tanks everyone for their valuable contribution
dataset.title: Bicycle plan 'Crowd Spot' community consultation

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne has installed in-ground parking bay sensors in most CBD parking bays. These sensors record when a vehicle arrives and when it departs. Each record  also includes the parking restriction for the bay and whether the vehicle has overstayed that restriction. This is the data for the 2011 calendar year
dataset.title: Parking Events 2011

dataset.description: This is the planned council works expenditure budget and the sources of funding for the budget. It should be noted that maintenance is included as part of the overall review of council works program but is funded out of the operating budget.
dataset.title: Council Works Program

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne has installed in-ground parking bay sensors in most CBD parking bays. These sensors record when a vehicle arrives and when it departs. Each record also includes the parking restriction for the bay and whether the vehicle has overstayed that restriction. This is the data for the 2014 calendar year
dataset.title: Parking Events 2014

dataset.description: Dataset Inventory - City of Melbourne
dataset.title: Dataset Inventory - City of Melbourne

dataset.description: The Statement of Cash Flow is a cash statement prepared in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards
dataset.title: Standard Statement of Cash Flows

dataset.description: The Income Statement is an accrual-based statement prepared in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards and generally adopted accounting principles. It includes non-cash items such as depreciation charges but does not include capital items such as capital works funding. While all due care has been taken in providing these figures, some errors and discrepancies may be present.
dataset.title: Standard Income Statement

dataset.description: The Balance Sheet is a representation of the Assets and Liabilities of the Council as at each financial year ending (30 June). While all due care has been taken in providing these figures, some errors and discrepancies may be present.
dataset.title: Standard Balance Sheet

dataset.description: The Sources of Funding - Operating is a Budgeted representation of the external grants to be received by the city of Melbourne to contribute to operating costs for the upcoming financial year. While all due care has been taken in providing these figures, some errors and discrepancies may be present.
dataset.title: Sources of Funding – Operating

dataset.description: The Sources of Funding Work is a budgeted representation of the external grants to be received by the city of Melbourne to contribute to Capital Works costs for the upcoming financial year. While all due care has been taken in providing these figures, some errors and discrepancies may be present.
dataset.title: Sources of Funding - Works

dataset.description: The statement of Changes in Equity is a statement which is a representation of accumulated surplus, revaluation reserve and other reserve movements at 30 June each financial year. While all due care has been taken in providing these figures, some errors and discrepancies may be present.
dataset.title: Statement of changes in equity

dataset.description:
The Statement of Capital Works has been included in accordance with the Local Government Regulations. This statement sets out all the expected capital expenditure in relation to non-current assets for the year. It categorises capital works expenditure into renewal of assets, upgrading of assets, or creating new assets. Each of these
categories has a different impact on Council’s future costs.
dataset.title: Statement of capital works program

dataset.description: The summary of planned Human Resources expenditure represents permanent council staff expenditure and numbers (see related dataset) of full time equivalent council staff categorised according to the organisational structure.
dataset.title: Summary of Planned Human Resources Expenditure

dataset.description: The summary of planned Human Resources expenditure represents permanent council staff expenditure (see related dataset) and numbers of full time equivalent council staff categorised according to the organisational structure.
dataset.title: Summary of Planned Human Resources Numbers

dataset.description: This is a list of all Fees and charges administered by the City of Melbourne. Where there is a change to or from $0 this reflects; a new facilities coming online or a new service offered, changes to the pricing structure as determined by the state government or a review of the existing pricing structure. Some fees and charges including GST status are subject to change following a review of Division 81 GST legislation.
dataset.title: Fees and Charges Schedule

dataset.description: This is a List of off property leases that are administered by the City of Melbourne
dataset.title: Property Lease Register

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne's Helping Out booklet provides a list of free and cheap support services available from more than 70 organisations. The list includes food, accommodation, health services, drug and alcohol services, and legal advice.
dataset.title: Helping Out

dataset.description: Melbourne Bike Share is a joint RACV/Victorian Government bicycle hire scheme. This dataset contains the locations of all of the bike share pods, the amount of bikes located at each pod and the number of empty slots at the pod.
dataset.title: Melbourne bike share

dataset.description: This dataset shows all of the streets and laneways within the City of Melbourne. This dataset is used in order for people to create their own map of the city and can be used to label the streets with their names down the centre of the road as is the standard for labelling streets on maps.
dataset.title: Street Name Labels

dataset.description: PLEASE NOTE: The raw files (GEOTiff and Esri database files) are available for download within the attachments of the About section,  please select the 'About' button and scroll down to see the attachments. Captured on 24th February 2012 this thermal image shows temperature differences between different surfaces in the municipality.
dataset.title: City of Melbourne Thermal Image (please see description for instructions)

dataset.description: Melbourne BioBlitz was the City of Melbourne's first citizen science event, where experts and members of the community worked together to discover, document and learn about the species that call our city home. More than 700 people participated in Melbourne BioBlitz, helping us record more than 3000 sightings and photographs. We are thrilled that so many people were interested in connecting with biodiversity in the City of Melbourne and we are delighted to share the results via this data set
dataset.title: Melbourne Bio blitz 2014

dataset.description: The Environmental data includes energy consumed and generated as well as greenhouse gas emissions from Council's assets and a portion of its supply chain.
dataset.title: Environmental Data - Assets

dataset.description: The Environmental data includes energy consumed and generated as well as greenhouse gas emissions from Council's assets and a portion of its supply chain.
dataset.title: Environmental Data - Billing data

dataset.description: The Environmental data includes energy consumed and generated as well as greenhouse gas emissions from Council's assets and a portion of its supply chain.
dataset.title: Environmental Data - GHG Factors data

dataset.description: In 2012, Council and ARUP partnered with the University of Melbourne on a three year Australian Research Council Linkage Grant for �Creating a Smart City through Internet of Things." The aim of the research was to �develop new systems and algorithms that can help City administrators remotely monitor, understand and interpret real time information on urban environments"  The researchers are now applying the research in the City by deploying a three month 'real-world' data collection and testing trial. The environmental sensors, measuring light levels, humidity and temperature, have been deployed at Fitzroy Gardens and Library at the Dock. The data collected will assist the Urban Landscapes branch to better understand and communicate the impact of canopy cover for urban cooling.
dataset.title: Trial Environmental sensor readings

dataset.description: Building accessibility types collected by the City of Melbourne's Census of Land Use and Employment 2012. Data is collected to track building accessibility for internal City of Melbourne purposes. This data is provided as a community service by the City of Melbourne. It is not and does not purport to be a complete guide. There may be errors or omissions. Data is liable to change. The City of Melbourne accepts no responsibility in respect of any claim arising from use or reliance upon this data.
dataset.title: Building Accessibility

dataset.description: Tree canopy within City of Melbourne mapped using 2008 aerial photos and LiDAR. The canopy polygons represent actual tree canopy extents on both private and public property across the city. The data is considered accurate for 2011. Changes in tree canopy are expected to have occurred since that time.
dataset.title: 2011 Tree Canopy - #Urbanforest

dataset.description: Tree canopy within City of Melbourne mapped using 2008 aerial photos and LiDAR. The canopy polygons represent actual tree canopy extents on both private and public property across the city. The data is considered accurate for 2008. Changes in tree canopy are expected to have occurred since that time.
dataset.title: 2008 Tree Canopy - #Urbanforest

dataset.description: These polygons represent approximate native soil sub-bases and derived textures based on digitized maps from the Geological Survey of Victoria (c. 1956). Soils are expected to be extensively modified from these types throughout Melbourne due to extensive disturbance, and cut and fill associated with the city's development.
dataset.title: Soils - #Urbanforest

dataset.description: These are points in the city where soils have been sampled at different depths and a soil texture has been assigned. Location represents the park and sample number. 0_400 refers to the depth from surface (0) to 400 mm. 400_700 refers to depth from 400 mm to 700 mm. 700_1000 refers to depth from 700 mm to 1000 mm
dataset.title: Soil Texture - #Urbanforest

dataset.description: This shapefile delineates historic water bodies including wetlands, the old Yarra River and Moonee Ponds Creek alignments and lakes (presumably seasonal and generally estuarine). The polygons are digitised from the 1855 map "Melbourne and its Suburbs" compiled by James Kearney, draughtsman ; engraved by David Tulloch and James D. Brown. http://handle.slv.vic.gov.au/10381/89107
dataset.title: Historic water bodies - #Urbanforest

dataset.description:
This shapefile delineates historic creek lines digitised from the 1855 map �Melbourne and its Suburbs" compiled by James Kearney, draughtsman ; engraved by David Tulloch and James D. Brown. http://handle.slv.vic.gov.au/10381/89107. The Elizabeth Street, Swanston Street and Fitzroy Garden creek alignments are included based on descriptions in: 
 
 1. Presland, Gary. 2009. Place for Village. 
 
 2. Burchett, Winston. 1978. East Melbourne, 1837-1977.
dataset.title: Historic Creeks - #Urbanforest

dataset.description: These flow routes are derived from the 2008 DEM surface using ESRI Spatial Analyst stream order tool with STRAHLER ordering. The GRID_CODE field represents stream order. Lines with no tributaries are assigned an order of one and are referred to as first order. When two first-order links intersect, the downslope link is assigned an order of two. When two second-order links intersect, the downslope link is assigned an order of three and so on. This was undertaken as part of the urbanforest program, the shapefile excludes a portion of Kensington that became part of City of Melbourne after this data was processed.
dataset.title: Overland Flow Routes - #Urbanforest

dataset.description: This shapefile contains the gradients of all City of Melbourne public footpaths. includes streets, laneways and park walkways. The gradients are expressed ion the distance of the section and the percentage gradient
dataset.title: Footpath Gradients

dataset.description: This shapefile shows all of the footprints of all buildings within the City of Melbourne. The footprint is the outline of the total area of a lot or site that is surrounded by the exterior walls of a building or portion of a building, exclusive of courtyards. In the absence of surrounding exterior walls, the building footprint shall be the area under the horizontal projection of the roof.
dataset.title: Building Foot Prints

dataset.description: This shapefile shows all of the public road and laneway segments within the City of Melbourne. This outlines the street name and the names of the between streets
dataset.title: Road Corridor

dataset.description: This Shapefile defines the boundaries and locations of all postcodes with the City of Melbourne
dataset.title: Post Code Areas

dataset.description: This details the boundaries of all properties within the City of Melbourne. A boundary is described as a division between adjacent political entities, tracts of private land, or geographic zones. Boundary lines may be imaginary lines, physical features that follow those lines, or the graphical representation of those lines on a map. Boundary lines between privately owned land parcels are usually called property lines.
dataset.title: Property Boundaries

dataset.description: This shapefile shows the boundary of the City of Melbourne municipality.
dataset.title: Municipal Boundary

dataset.description: The City Circle tram service operates within Melbourne's central business district. The service operates in a circular route passing major tourist attractions, as well as linking with other tram, train and bus routes in and around Melbourne. This maps shows the location of the stops on the route.
dataset.title: City Circle Stops

dataset.description: The City Circle tram service operates within Melbourne's central business district. The service operates in a circular route passing major tourist attractions, as well as linking with other tram, train and bus routes in and around Melbourne. This maps shows the location of the stops on the route.
dataset.title: City Circle Route

dataset.description: This shapfile contains the location information (latitude and Longitude, Northing and Easting) of every property address within the City of Melbourne
dataset.title: Address Points

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne maintains a register of all syringe disposal bins located with the City. This register contains descriptions of each of the disposal bins and their geographical location.
dataset.title: Syringe Bins

dataset.description: From the City of Melbourne's Census of Land Use and Employment (CLUE), total area (sq m) of built floor space in each CLUE Small Area, categorised by census year and use.
dataset.title: Total Built Floor Space - By Space Use and Small Area - 2002 to 2012

dataset.description: From the City of Melbourne's Census of Land Use and Employment (CLUE), total area (sq m) of outdoor space, (excluding road and waterway area) in each CLUE small area, categorised by Census year and use.
dataset.title: Total Outdoor Space - By Small Area - 2002 to 2012

keyword: census of land use and employment
dataset.description: Spatial layer of small areas used for the City of Melbourne's Census Of Land Use And Employment (CLUE) analysis. Note that these small area boundaries do not exactly correspond with gazetted suburb or postcode boundaries.
dataset.title: Census Of Land Use And Employment (CLUE) Small Area - Map

dataset.description: This dataset contains a description and co-ordinates of places of interest within the City of Melbourne
dataset.title: Landmarks and Places of Interest

dataset.description: This dataset holds the description, type and geographical location of all BBQs in the City of Melbourne
dataset.title: Public Barbeques

dataset.description: This dataset holds the description, type and geographical location of all drinking fountains in the City of Melbourne
dataset.title: Drinking Fountains

keyword: census of land use and employment
dataset.description: From the City of Melbourne's Census of Land Use and Employment (CLUE), total employment (number of all jobs including full time, part time, casual and contract) in the municipality, categorised by industry and census year.
dataset.title: Total Employment - By Industry - 2002 to 2012

dataset.description: The Melbourne Visitor Shuttle is a great way to explore inner city Melbourne. Ride in comfort while listening to stories about the city's colourful past and current quirks. There are 13 stops where you can hop on and hop off. Their descriptions and locations are maintained within this dataset
dataset.title: Melbourne Visitor Shuttle Bus Stops

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne maintains a register of all public artwork, fountains and monuments located within the City. This dataset contains various information regarding the type, category and geographical location of the artwork.
dataset.title: Melbourne Public Artwork

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne maintains a register of all of the sculptures and memorials located within the city; this record set contains various details in relation to the artwork and location within the City of Melbourne.
dataset.title: Public Memorials and Sculptures

dataset.description: The City of Melbourne maintains a register of all public toilet facilities located within the city, this data set includes descriptions, types (male, female, disabled), facilities available and locations
dataset.title: Public Toilets

keyword: census of land use and employment
dataset.description: Spatial layer showing location of Census of Land Use and Employment (CLUE) boundaries and the 2012 count of employment, establishments and floor space for each block.
dataset.title: Census of Land Use and Employment Blocks - 2012 - Map
